NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
January 13, 19S3
Lor. Wilbur Schramm
Sean, Division of Communications
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Wilbur i
First may I say it was indeed a great pleasure to see
you again and to visit in your home* I appreciate most profoundly
the opportunity of talking over our NAEB problems with you and
value more than I can say the advice and reactions from you.
One of the problems which we did not finally settle
was the arrangement for Frank *s time between now and June 1 in
the capacity of Executive Director. Frank and I discussed this
at some length but we did not arrive at any conclusion* I
suggested that you keep him on in his full capacity with the
University of Illinois and that HAEB contribute rather generously
to him for his time* This would enable him to pick up some
additional money tfiich may in small measure pay him for the many
years of conscientious service he has given this organization*
We both know that Frank will give full measure to his job with
the University of Illinois and to the HAEB and I feel that he
should be amply rewarded for the extra energy and time he will
give* Frank had a definite idea of how the arrangement should
be made and proposed that the approximately 8QjC of his salary
he is now receiving for the station supervision be turned back
to the University of Illinois for this interim period*
My only concern is that Frank be well taken care of
for this job* With this in mind, will you please make whatever
arrangements you and Frank think advisable and best and let me
know directly or through Frank what the plan is. I will then
submit this to the Board for approval. Incidentally, I can see
no reason why we should designate Frank as Acting or Interim
Executive Director but simply add Executive Director to his
title of Treasurer for the organization fbr this period.
lou will recall that we asked Jim to go ahead with
pollli^: together our thinking on the type of training which
might be needed to supplement the training now being afforded
through the scholar di ips, fellowships, and internships program*
I am sure he will carry you along with him as he shapes up any
pirns for an expansion of the current program and that you in
turn will advise me of the most satisfactory way of proceeding
